meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Jen Huff Tim Klein Tom Nissley Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #6044.

td.p: Jen Huff, a technical support representative from Hollidaysburg, Pennsylvania
Tim Klein, a public school technology specialist from Flemington, New Jersey
Tom Nissley, an online books editor from Seattle, Washington (whose 2-day cash winnings total $48,002)

tr.td: THE AMERICAN RED CROSS
SOCCER TO US!
(Alex: In honor of its 65th anniversary, a whole category devoted to...)
BASKIN ROBBINS ICE CREAM
WOODWINDS
LANGUAGE CRAFT
ADD A LETTER

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_1_1', 'clue_J_1_1_stuck', '(Kelly of the Clue Crew gives the clue from the American Red Cross in Washington, D.C.) It\'s no coincidence that the Red Cross emblem looks like this country\'s flag in reverse; the International Red Cross began there in 1863')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: (Kelly of the Clue Crew gives the clue from the American Red Cross in Washington, D.C.) It's no coincidence that the Red Cross emblem looks like this country's flag in reverse; the International Red Cross began there in 1863

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_2_1', 'clue_J_2_1_stuck', 'In 2002 Germany\'s Oliver Kahn was named World Cup MVP, the first from this position that may hand-le the ball')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: In 2002 Germany's Oliver Kahn was named World Cup MVP, the first from this position that may hand-le the ball

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_3_1', 'clue_J_3_1_stuck', 'A seasonal favorite, baseball nut first hit a home run in 1958 to celebrate the Dodgers\' move from this borough')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: A seasonal favorite, baseball nut first hit a home run in 1958 to celebrate the Dodgers' move from this borough

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_4_1', 'clue_J_4_1_stuck', 'The shakuhachi, a Japanese flute made of this tall grass, is used as a tool for Buddhist meditation & many types of music')

tr.td: (Kelly of the Clue Crew gives the clue from the American Red Cross in Washington, D.C.) One of the best ways you can help the Red Cross is to donate blood, & since you can do it every 56 days, that's this many times a year
